1.brief: to associate; by implication, to overshadow (by huddling together)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors

2.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to suspend in a balance, i.e. weigh

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)

3.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
the breast of a woman or animal (as bulging)
to suck; causatively, to give milk
a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
violent; by implication deadly; also (in a good sense) brave
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the ostrich (probably from its answering cry
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

4.brief: properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to suck; causatively, to give milk
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

5.brief: to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the crimson-grub, but used only (in this connection) of the colorfrom it, and cloths dyed therewith
to clasp (the hands or in embrace)
a heap of rubbish or filth

6.brief: to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
Sedom, a place near the Dead Sea
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

7.brief: to be transparent or clean (phys. or morally)
separate, i.e. consecrated (as prince, a Nazirite); hence (figuratively from the latter) an unpruned vine (like an unshorn Nazirite)
to glare, i.e. be dazzling white
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
a gem (perhaps used for scratching other substances), probably the sapphire
the figure or person (as if cut out); also an inclosure (as separated)

8.brief: to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)

9.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
to flow freely (as water), i.e. (specifically) to have a (sexual) flux; figuratively, to waste away; also to overflow
to stab; by analogy, to starve; figuratively, to revile

10.brief: a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to boil up; hence, to be done in cooking; figuratively to ripen
something born, i.e. a lad or offspring
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to select; to feed; to render clear
a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

11.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to burn or set on fire; figuratively, to desolate
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

12.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

13.brief: an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)

14.brief: to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife

15.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to flash; hence, to blossom (from the brilliancy of color); also, to fly away (from the quickness of motion)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care

literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

17.brief: properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
near, with or among; often in general, to
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await

a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

18.brief: to lie alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to catch an animal (figuratively, men); to victual (for a journey)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

20.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

to become tipsy; in a qualified sense, to satiate with astimulating drink or (figuratively) influence
to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish
